title: MapfortheHomeless
name: MapfortheHomeless
description:
A Map by Poetdog

A map where people who are homeless can map their...  existence.  and be counted.  if you are homeless, or know someone who is homeless, please Add a Place.  You can list a broad reference, such as your City Name.

properties.name: Arbor Circle Corporation - The Bridge and Homeless Youth Services
properties.description: Posted by Mnyf1115 Ball Avenue NE Grand Rapids Michigan 49505The Bridge 1115 Ball Avenue NE Grand Rapids, MI 49505 Phone: 616 451-3001 Fax : 616 451-8779 Provides runaway shelter services to youth between the ages of 10-17. Homeless youth services (non-shelter based) available for youth between the ages of 16-21.Arbor Circle offers unique respite and transitional living programming for families and youth in need of supportive services. The Bridge offers safe short-term shelter and counseling for runaway and endangered youth in crisis. Homeless Youth Services provides case management and coordinated services to young people who are lack adult support and stable housing.

properties.name: Boston, Mass:  5,819 census homeless (single day estimate) 2005
properties.description: Posted by Poetdog415 Summer St, Boston, MAfrom the website: "Many cities in the United States take an annual census of their homeless population, and use this data for decision making and also report it to the federal agency, HUD, as it is required for any city receiving federal monies for the homeless, especially for housing. The methods used for counting the number of homeless may vary from city to city.[18] December 2005 homeless estimates from major U.S. cities (single day estimate):[19] * Boston - 5,819 (total area population 569,165)~1.0% * Chicago - 6,715 (total area population 2,862,244)~0.2% * Denver - 5,000 (total population 580,000)~0.8% * Detroit - 14,827 (total area population 900,198)~1.6% * Los Angeles - 91,000 (total area population 3,300,000)~2.7% * New York - 48,155 (total area population 8,104,179)~0.5% * San Francisco - 6,248 (total area population 744,230)~0.8% * Seattle - 8,000 (total population 560,000)~1.4% * Washington DC - 5,518 (total area population 553,523)~0.9%"

properties.name: Heartside Community Garden
properties.description: Posted by Stek  This is the Heartside Community Garden. I had the priviledge of tilling the soil in this garden one year. Thanks Richa. This was my first larger garden experience. I had a six by twenty foot space to work with and plant what I wish. I had to clear the spot and turn the sod as it had become overgrown. I planted watermelon, squash, purple pole beans on a crucifix I salvaged from the basement of the apartment I was living in, lemon cucumbers (yellow and roundish), and tomatoes. The plot went pretty wild that summer and the garden was eventually overrun by the transient community in the area, but we got a bumper crop of beans! I donated my harvest to the Hard Times Cafe, a local group of homeless folk who gathered to cook, eat, and dicuss their situation. I had one watermelon that made it and it was given as a birthday present to one of the chaps at the Cafe. All in all it was a good summer project and a lot of fun to boot!

properties.name: Ohio: 27,867 estimated homeless any given night in 2001
properties.description: Posted by Poetdog400 N High St, Columbus, OHfrom the website: "To determine the estimated point-in-time homeless population: As just reported, approximately 700,000 homeless people in this country on any given night are homeless. The country\'s total population for 2001 was 285 million. If you divide the estimated point-in-time homeless figure (700,000) by the total population (285 million), you can estimate that approximately .00245 percent of the country\'s total population experienced homelessness on any given night in 2001. If you apply that rationale to Ohio\'s total population (11, 374,541), you can estimate that 27,867 Ohioans experienced homelessness on any given night in 2001."

properties.name: Starfish Family Service - Counterpoint Shelter
properties.description: Posted by Mnyf 715 S. Inkster Rd. Inkster Michigan 48141715 S. Inkster Rd. Inkster, MI 48141 313-563-5005 313-563-4765 (fax) (866) 672-HELP (4357) Toll Free Counterpoint Shelter and Crisis Center provides homeless and runaway teens between the ages of 10 and 17 years with access to a 24-hour crisis line, temporary shelter, individual and group counseling and support, HIV/AIDS and substance abuse prevention education, as well as case management services designed to encourage problem resolution and family reunification whenever safe to do so.

properties.name: Washington,DC:  14,537 homeless in 06/02
properties.description: Posted by Poetdog945 G St Nw, Washington, DCfrom the washington post article: "The fourth annual point-in-time survey counted 14,537 homeless men, women and children -- up 1.8 percent from last year\'s <2001> survey by the Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments. ... The tally includes 11,386 people considered "literally homeless": living outdoors, in precarious housing or in transitional programs, or relying upon the area\'s patchwork of emergency shelters and services for help. An additional 3,151 are considered "permanently supported homeless," depending upon homeless services but in a stable setting."

properties.name: Where I saw the homeless woman smoking
properties.description: Posted by EdsheppThis is where I saw a homeless woman smoking one day. Not smoking a cigarette, but smoking, as in \'on fire.\' Someone tried to pat her down to put the fire out, but she wouldn\'t have it. She was certainly schizophrenic. It was quite a sight, I must say.

properties.name: Yoyogi Park (よよぎ　公園） - Sarah
properties.description: Posted by Yeahmateyeah  One of the largest parks in Tokyo. Situated between Shibuya and Harajuku, two of the most well known Tokyo shopping districts. The famous Meiji-Jingu (Meiji Shrine) is located in the middle. -- On our first night in Japan as complete strangers, the cabbie dropped us off on the wrong side of the park. Walking through in complete darkness, trying to get through to Yoyogi Olympic Centre/Youth Hostel, we encountered several homeless, scary ravens, two men TAPDANCING, and many dead ends.
